alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Globe, Miami; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 9:47PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 1030 PM MST... At 946 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Queen Valley, or 9 miles southeast of Gold Canyon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Coolidge, Superior, Gold Canyon, Top Of The World, Gold Camp, Magma, Queen Valley, Kings Ranch, Boyce Thompson Arboretum, Randolph, Blackwater, and Valley Farms. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 203 and 242. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 138. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Globe, Miami; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior; Tonto Basin
